text: CREB Is a Target for Transcriptional Repression by <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1>

Although <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> could down - regulate <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - dependent transactivation of the HTLV-I LTR ( Figure 4B ) and inhibit <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression from an infectious molecular clone ( Figure 5 ) , <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> failed to modulate <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> function in the absence of the viral promoter ( Figure 4D ) .

text: These results led us to hypothesize that <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> acts on HTLV-I gene expression by interacting with proteins important for driving HTLV-I LTR activity in vivo .

Previous studies have demonstrated that the Tax - responsive elements within the HTLV-I LTR play a crucial role in driving <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated transactivation of the HTLV-I LTR [ 18 ] .

The Tax - responsive elements have been shown to resemble CREB binding sites , bind CREB in vitro and in vivo , and facilitate HTLV-I LTR activation both in the presence and in the absence of <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> [ 35 , 36 ] .

Ching and colleagues [ 18 ] demonstrated that addition of a dominant - negative CREB expression vector resulted in nearly complete inhibition of <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated activation of the HTLV-I LTR , while blocking NF-kappaB activation by addition of a dominant - negative <extra_id_0> IKKbeta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression vector had no effect on <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transactivation of the HTLV-I LTR .

Therefore , we hypothesized that <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> may inhibit <extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transactivation of the HTLV-I LTR via disruption of the CREB signaling pathway .

To test this possibility , HEK 293T cells were transfected with an HTLV-I LTR or synthetic CREB reporter vector along with a control expression vector ( EGFP ) or expression vectors encoding <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> deltaFKH <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

As shown in Figure 6A , <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> down-regulated basal activation of the HTLV-I LTR and transcription of a synthetic CREB reporter vector , suggesting that <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> down-regulates HTLV-I LTR activation by targeting the CREB pathway .

Deletion of the FKH domain of <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> dampened the suppressive effect of <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , but did not completely abrogate suppression , as is seen with NF-kappaB - responsive promoters in HEK 293T cells .

Like NF-kappaB activation , CREB transcriptional activation was also suppressed by expression of <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and to a similar extent <extra_id_0> deltaFKH <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , in healthy donor <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells ( Figure 6B ) .

text: Similarly , <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> deltaFKH <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> also repressed basal HTLV-I LTR activation in primary human <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells ( Figure 6C ) .
To our knowledge , this is the first evidence implicating CREB as a molecular target of <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

As observed with NF-kappaB activation , <extra_id_0> deltaFKH <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was a more potent inhibitor of <extra_id_0> CREB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activation in <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells than in HEK 293T cells , further indicating that a cell type - specific mechanism of action may govern the function of this Foxp3 mutant .

text: To determine whether <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> functioned by directly signaling through CREB , we utilized expression vectors encoding <extra_id_0> CREB-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> c-Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( a member of the <extra_id_0> activator protein 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> family of transcription factors ) fused in - frame to the <extra_id_0> Gal4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - BD ( <extra_id_0> Gal4-BD-CREB-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Gal4-BD-c-Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) .

text: As shown in Figure 6D , activation of a <extra_id_0> Gal4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - responsive reporter vector by <extra_id_0> Gal4-BD-CREB-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was down-regulated by <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> compared to control vector ( EGFP ) , indicating that <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> functions by directly or indirectly interacting with <extra_id_0> CREB-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: However , <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> failed to markedly affect transcriptional activation of <extra_id_0> Gal4-BD-c-Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> c-Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> has also been demonstrated to bind to the HTLV-I LTR ) and <extra_id_0> Gal4-BD-Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( see Figure 5 ) .

Importantly , the mechanism of <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated inhibition of CREB - dependent transcription was not due to a block in <extra_id_0> CREB-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein expression , as determined by Western blot analysis ( Figure 6E ) .

text: Although these results demonstrate that <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> functions as a co - repressor of CREB activation ( in addition to NF-kappaB and NF - AT ) , we were unable to detect a direct physical interaction between <extra_id_0> CREB-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by coimmunoprecipitation or mammalian two-hybrid analysis ( unpublished data ) .
